trans-unit.source: ***Please Note:*** *This content is placeholder. The links below point to WMF 5.0 versions, and will be updated when binaries are released.*
trans-unit.target: ***Please Note:*** *This content is placeholder. The links below point to WMF 5.0 versions, and will be updated when binaries are released.*

trans-unit.source: Download the WMF 5.1 package for the operating system and architecture you wish to install it on:
trans-unit.target: Download the WMF 5.1 package for the operating system and architecture you wish to install it on:

trans-unit.source: Install WMF 5.1 from Windows Explorer (or File Explorer in Windows Server 2012 R2 or Windows 8.1)
trans-unit.target: Install WMF 5.1 from Windows Explorer (or File Explorer in Windows Server 2012 R2 or Windows 8.1)

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the folder into which you downloaded the MSU file.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the folder into which you downloaded the MSU file.

trans-unit.source: Double-click the MSU to run it.
trans-unit.target: Double-click the MSU to run it.

trans-unit.source: Install WMF 5.1 from the command prompt
trans-unit.target: Install WMF 5.1 from the command prompt

trans-unit.source: After downloading the correct package for your computer's architecture, open a Command Prompt window with elevated user rights (Run as Administrator).
trans-unit.target: After downloading the correct package for your computer's architecture, open a Command Prompt window with elevated user rights (Run as Administrator).

trans-unit.source: On the Server Core installation options of Windows Server 2012 R2 or Windows Server 2012 or Windows Server 2008 R2 SP1, Command Prompt opens with elevated user rights by default.
trans-unit.target: On the Server Core installation options of Windows Server 2012 R2 or Windows Server 2012 or Windows Server 2008 R2 SP1, Command Prompt opens with elevated user rights by default.

trans-unit.source: Change directories to the folder into which you have downloaded or copied the WMF 5.1 installation package.
trans-unit.target: Change directories to the folder into which you have downloaded or copied the WMF 5.1 installation package.

trans-unit.source: Run one of the following commands:
trans-unit.target: Run one of the following commands:

trans-unit.source: On computers that are running Windows Server 2012 R2 or Windows 8.1 x64, run `Win8.1AndW2K12R2-KB3156422-x64.msu /quiet`.
trans-unit.target: On computers that are running Windows Server 2012 R2 or Windows 8.1 x64, run `Win8.1AndW2K12R2-KB3156422-x64.msu /quiet`.

trans-unit.source: On computers that are running Windows Server 2012, run `W2K12-KB3156423-x64.msu /quiet`.
trans-unit.target: On computers that are running Windows Server 2012, run `W2K12-KB3156423-x64.msu /quiet`.

trans-unit.source: On computers that are running Windows Server 2008 R2 SP1 or Windows 7 SP1 x64, run `Win7AndW2K8R2-KB3156424-x64.msu /quiet`.
trans-unit.target: On computers that are running Windows Server 2008 R2 SP1 or Windows 7 SP1 x64, run `Win7AndW2K8R2-KB3156424-x64.msu /quiet`.

trans-unit.source: On computers that are running Windows 8.1 x86, run `Win8.1-KB3156422-x86.msu /quiet`.
trans-unit.target: On computers that are running Windows 8.1 x86, run `Win8.1-KB3156422-x86.msu /quiet`.

trans-unit.source: On computers that are running Windows 7 SP1 x86, run `Win7-KB3156424-x86.msu /quiet`.
trans-unit.target: On computers that are running Windows 7 SP1 x86, run `Win7-KB3156424-x86.msu /quiet`.

trans-unit.source: Additional Installation Notes for Windows Server 2008 SP1 and Windows 7 SP1
trans-unit.target: Additional Installation Notes for Windows Server 2008 SP1 and Windows 7 SP1

trans-unit.source: Installation of WMF 5.1 on either Windows Server 2008 SP1 or Windows 7 SP1, require the installation of:
trans-unit.target: Installation of WMF 5.1 on either Windows Server 2008 SP1 or Windows 7 SP1, require the installation of:

trans-unit.source: **WinRM Dependency** - Windows PowerShell Desired State Configuration (DSC) depends on WinRM.
trans-unit.target: **WinRM Dependency** - Windows PowerShell Desired State Configuration (DSC) depends on WinRM.

trans-unit.source: WinRM is not enabled by default on Windows Server 2008 R2 and Windows 7.
trans-unit.target: WinRM is not enabled by default on Windows Server 2008 R2 and Windows 7.

trans-unit.source: To enable WinRM, in a Windows PowerShell elevated session, run `Set-WSManQuickConfig`.
trans-unit.target: To enable WinRM, in a Windows PowerShell elevated session, run `Set-WSManQuickConfig`.
